images.caption: Figure 1:Synthetic data experiment.ThePGloss when paired with the optimal reward function matches the NLL-trained baseline in terms of NLL (left panel), all while having faster convergence in terms of moment matching (center and right panels for the mean and variance, respectively).

Figure 2:Learned distributions comparison on a single data point.ThePGloss paired with the optimal reward function inassumption4.2shows optimal convergence, even when compared with the baseline directly optimizing the NLL.

Figure 3:Implicit differentiation solver on synthetic data experiment.From left to right:-a-outer loss (NLL),-b-inner reward optimization loop,-c-trajectory of the reward parameteru\mathrm{u},-d-gradient of the outer loss with respect tou\mathrm{u},-e-the outer loss landscape.
